{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Oncotype DX test is a genomic test that analyzes the activity of a group of genes that can affect how a cancer is likely to behave and respond to treatment. It is used in breast cancer to help determine a woman's risk of early-stage, estrogen-receptor-positive (ER+) breast cancer coming back (recurrence), as well as how likely she is to benefit from chemotherapy after breast cancer surgery. Therefore, it is used to guide decisions on whether chemotherapy is needed in hormone receptor positive patients.", "answer_choice": "A"}
